title: Opera and ‘Yat’ want you to buy emoji web domains that don’t belong to you
content:
There has been a significant uptick in new top-level domains (TLDs) over the past few years, allowing anyone to buy web domains with endings like .pizza or .party, as an alternative to older TLDs like .com and .net. Some groups have been working on other alternatives to the domain registrar system entirely, such as a

The post Opera and ‘Yat’ want you to buy emoji web domains that don’t belong to you appeared first on xda-developers.
description: Yat is selling web domain-like identifiers that use emojis, and Opera now supports them on desktop and mobile platforms.
